ETYMOLOGY: From Old French *prophecie*, from Latin *prophetia*, from Ancient Greek *prophēteía* (προφητεία, 'gift of interpreting the will of the gods'), from *prophētēs* (προφήτης, 'prophet').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: (noun) a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A prediction of what will happen in the future.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 对未来事件的预言或预告。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The ancient prophecy spoke of a hero who would unite the kingdoms.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 古老的预言谈到一个将统一王国的英雄。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: (noun) a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The inspired declaration of divine will and purpose, or the faculty of foretelling future events, especially under divine inspiration.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 预言的能力或行为，尤指受神启示对未来事件的预告或神意的宣告。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Many religious traditions acknowledge the gift of prophecy as a spiritual charism.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 许多宗教传统都承认预言恩赐是一种精神魅力。

REGISTER: Formal or literary, often associated with religious, mystical, or fantasy contexts.
